title: Texas Hill Country Floods Kill 13; Over 20 Children Missing
snippets: Months worth of heavy rain fell in a matter of hours on Texas Hill Country, killing at least 13 people in US.
Authorities in the US state confirmed more than 20 children who attended a summer camp were still missing as a result of the flooding along the Guadalupe River.

Up to 10in of rain fell overnight, prompting flash flooding in region west of Austin hit by long drought

Thunderstorms and torrential rain triggered deadly flash flooding along the Guadalupe River in Texas on Friday, killing at least 13 people and leaving more than 20 girls from a summer ca

Texas Hill Country was beset by death and disaster Friday as at least six people were killed and about 20 girls attending a summer camp were reported missing after months worth of heavy rain fell in a matter of hours.
The National Weather Service issued at least five flash flood emergencies, the most severe form of flood warning, Friday in several counties in south-central Texas.
Camp Mystic is located in Hunt, Texas; 20 girls are unaccounted for, according to Lt. Gov. Dan Patrick.
At least 10 inches of rain poured down overnight in central Kerr County, causing flash flooding of the Guadalupe River.

KERRVILLE, Texas (AP) ‚Äî Months worth of heavy rain fell in a matter of hours on Texas Hill Country, leaving at least 13 people dead and many more unaccounted for Friday, including about 20 girls attending a summer camp, as search teams conducted boat and helicopter rescues in fast-moving floodwaters

summary: Heavy rain in Texas Hill Country resulted in catastrophic flooding, killing at least 13 people. The flooding, caused by up to 10 inches of rain overnight, particularly affected the region west of Austin. Over 20 children from Camp Mystic in Hunt, Texas, attending a summer camp, are reported missing. The National Weather Service issued severe flood warnings for south-central Texas. Search efforts for the missing are ongoing, involving boat and helicopter rescues along the Guadalupe River.
constructiveness_reason: This story, while reporting on a tragic event, provides useful information about the severity of the flooding in Texas Hill Country, the ongoing search efforts, and the areas most affected. summary: Emma Raducanu, the British number one, was eliminated from Wimbledon in a closely contested third-round match against world No. 1 Aryna Sabalenka, losing 7-6 (6), 6-4. Despite leading in both sets, Raducanu was unable to secure victory, expressing frustration over having to re-string several rackets during the match. The game, which took place under the Centre Court's closed retractable roof, captivated 15,000 spectators with its intensity. Meanwhile, in another upset, Madison Keys, the No. 6 seed and reigning Australian Open champion, was defeated by 104th-ranked Laura Siegemund.

title: Russia Launches Largest Aerial Assault on Kyiv in Over 3 Years

Despite these events, President Trump acknowledged that his discussions with Putin did not yield any progress.
